title: Tarso Genro
text:
Tarso Fernando Herz Genro (born March 6, 1947) is a left-wing <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>ian <a href="politician">politician</a> from the southern state of <a href="Rio%20Grande%20do%20Sul">Rio Grande do Sul</a>. A prominent associate of <a href="Luiz%20In%C3%A1cio%20Lula%20da%20Silva">Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva</a>, Genro was one of the most important leaders of the <a href="Workers%27%20Party%20%28Brazil%29">Workers' Party</a> (PT) in the 2000s.
Biography.
Genro was born to a working-class family in <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Borja%2C%20Rio%20Grande%20do%20Sul">São Borja, Rio Grande do Sul</a>, Genro was active in politics from a young age. In the early 1980s, Genro was a spokesman for the <a href="Revolutionary%20Communist%20Party%20%28Brazil%29">Communist Revolutionary Party</a> (PRC) along with his brother, Adelmo Genro Filho.
As a member of the Workers' Party (PT), he was elected deputy mayor of <a href="Porto%20Alegre">Porto Alegre</a> by the "Popular Front", a list headed by Olívio Dutra, a fellow member of the PT. He accumulated the position of vice mayor with that of government secretary. In 1992, Genro was elected to the position of <a href="Mayor%20of%20Porto%20Alegre">Mayor of Porto Alegre</a>, though he lost reelection in 1996. In <a href="1998%20Brazilian%20general%20election">1998</a>, he was speculated to be a potential presidential candidate for the PT in the place of Lula, though Lula ended up running
As a result of the <a href="Mensal%C3%A3o%20scandal">Mensalão scandal</a>, Genro served the remainder of <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Geno%C3%ADno">José Genoíno</a>'s term as party president in 2005. <a href="Ricardo%20Berzoini">Ricardo Berzoini</a> was elected to the post later that year.
Following his service as interim president, Genro was a top political adviser to <a href="Luiz%20In%C3%A1cio%20Lula%20da%20Silva">Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva</a>, former <a href="President%20of%20Brazil">President of Brazil</a> (2006–2010), during the contentious, but quite successful, <a href="2006%20Brazilian%20general%20election">2006 Presidential campaign</a>. On 16 March 2007, he became the new Minister of Justice in Lula's <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Brazil">cabinet</a>. In <a href="2010%20Brazilian%20presidential%20election">2010</a>, Genro was mentioned as a possible successor to Lula, though the PT nomination went to eventual winner <a href="Dilma%20Rousseff">Dilma Rousseff</a>.
Personal life.
His daughter, <a href="Luciana%20Genro">Luciana Genro</a>, is a prominent socialist politician in Brazil who served as the presidential candidate of the <a href="Socialism%20and%20Liberty%20Party">Socialism and Liberty Party</a> (PSOL) in <a href="2014%20Brazilian%20general%20election">2014</a>.
